definition: to attend to/to care for (patients etc)/to look after/to wait upon/to serve/also written 伏侍, see also 服事[fu2 shi4]

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: To be served in distress is to be caressed.
sentences.chinese: 在那種痛苦中，有人服侍，便是有人撫愛。

sentences.english: The old portress who had served him was among the number.
sentences.chinese: 服侍過他的那個老看門婆便是其中之一。

sentences.english: To serve God by serving others.
sentences.chinese: 藉著服侍其他人來事奉神。

sentences.english: You were saved to serve God.
How can a Bavarian fest be complete without a beer garden?
sentences.chinese: 第一大衆被服侍到巴伐利亞的總理。

sentences.english: At noon, I strengthened up and served mother with the lunch.
sentences.chinese: 中午，我打起精神服侍媽媽吃了午飯。

sentences.english: Look at how you can serve other people.
sentences.chinese: 看看你可以如何服侍別人。

sentences.english: We are waiting for the staff to serve us our three-course meal for the evening.
sentences.chinese: 我們等着職員來服侍三道菜的晚餐。

sentences.english: Dobby's bound to serve one family forever.
sentences.chinese: 多比要一輩子地服侍一個家庭。

sentences.english: If you do not have a servant’s heart, you are not worthy of being served.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有一顆僕人的心，你也不值得讓別人服侍你。

sentences.english: I write to serve the church.
Jesus, however, measured greatness in terms of service, not status.
sentences.chinese: 然而，耶穌卻以服侍而非地位來衡量偉大。

sentences.english: Give him of your heart or serve him.
sentences.chinese: 把你的心交給他或是服侍他吧。

sentences.english: Mother Du smiles but doesnt answer and served too madam Xie.
sentences.chinese: 杜媽媽笑而不答，服侍太夫人歇了。

sentences.english: Less-than-perfect service is always better than the best intention.
sentences.chinese: 不夠完美的服侍永遠好於完美的打算。

definition: to wait upon/to serve/to attend to sb's needs
to tend/to take care of sb
